hackathon-description-text: A vibrant one-day hackathon-style event where DevOps pros (and curious/skeptical IT guys) can get a jumpstart in using OpenStack to bring value to their company by automating their infrastructure.  Contestants will be judged by a panel of experts and prizes will be awarded to winners.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: CEO / Orange and Bronze Software Labs

hackathon-requirements:
1.  Sign up for a ChallengePost account at
     2.Visit the Hackathon Name website at
hackathon-rules:
Morphlabs employees will present three example modules in the format of "building blocks and how they can be combined to solve a problem".  
. 

Given an OpenStack environment (local or remote), with access to the provisioning and management tools provided:
Contestants have 5 hours in the ultimate DevOps playground, OpenStack. Morphlabs employees will be around to coach and assist.  At the end, contestants that have a working solution will present it to attendees and the judges, and they will be scored against several criteria.  Contestants will be judged by a panel of experts and prizes will be awarded to winners.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Winning Team will be flown to Hong Kong for Summit and recieve all access passes to the OpenStack Summit

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=De La Salle University, 2401 Taft Avenue, Manila 1004, Philippines

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How relevant are the problems you are solving? Do many organizations face these? Is there a benefit to automating these?
Is the solution actually easy for sysads (or customers) to use?

hackathon-location-address: De La Salle University, 2401 Taft Avenue, Manila 1004, Philippines
